page.title: 06Farming in 1985 (1)
page.content: We interviewed{a young farmer,Paul {Fearn}of Handley Fields Farm,who said: Farming has become more{mechanised now because of machines like combine harvesters. Farmers do not need to employ much casual labour.{Sprays}are used to kill all the weeds and a high rate of{fertiliser}is used. Since the 1960's cattle have been de-horned to prevent them from damaging one another. { Milking}is more efficient now. The milking parlour and cubicle mean that more cows can be milked an hour and less time is spent carrying equipment and cleansing. Cows give more milk now and there is bulk collection with a tanker calling every morning. The milk{quality controls}have made it difficult for young farmers to set up in business. The 1983 output is taken less 9% and this prevents expansion.
